meanings.definition: A group or team formed to do a particular job.
examples: Addams and her staff gave classes in English literacy, art, and other subjects.

images.caption: Staff gather during a break from working.

examples: When they lobbied, they contacted public officials and legislators and asked them to pass certain laws and take other actions to benefit a community.

meanings.definition: To cause, urge, stimulate or influence to do.
examples: Inspired by Toynbee Hall, Addams and her friend, Ellen Gates Starr, opened Hull House in a neighborhood of slums in Chicago in 1889.

images.alt: Photo of a cork board covered with notes.
images.description: A cork board with short inspirational notes.
images.caption: A vision board can inspire and motivate.

meanings.definition: To push or drive forward or onward.
examples: When they lobbied, they contacted public officials and legislators and urged them to pass certain laws and take other actions to benefit a community.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel a sudden, sharp excitement.
examples: He struck a note and was thrilled with the sound.

images.alt: Photo of a person with an excited expression.
images.description: A person looking at her phone. She has a happy, excited expression on her face.
images.caption: She is thrilled with the news she just saw!

meanings.definition: To cause, urge, stimulate or influence to do.
examples: Galvanized by Toynbee Hall, Addams and her friend, Ellen Gates Starr, opened Hull House in a neighborhood of slums in Chicago in 1889.

images.alt: Photo of a cork board covered with notes.
images.description: A cork board with short inspirational notes.
images.caption: A vision board can inspire and galvanize people into action.

meanings.definition: To push or drive forward or onward.
examples: When they lobbied, they contacted public officials and legislators and implored them to pass certain laws and take other actions to benefit a community.
Child labor meant that many young children worked in factories instead of going to school.

meanings.definition: To try to influence people who make laws.
examples: Addams lobbied to government officials to get laws to protect children.

images.alt: Two students talking to a person in a suit.
images.description: Photo of students talking to people outside the U.S. Capitol building.
images.caption: Two students are lobbying to convince a member of Congress to take action.

source.title: NEA North Carolina High School Students and Teachers lobby Congress to stop ICE Immigration Raids and for the release of undocumented students held in detention
source.author: NEA Public Relations

meanings.definition: The condition of being known for something.
examples: That restaurant has a reputation for fast service.

meanings.definition: Having to do with a city or town.
examples: This urban area is home to thousands of people and businesses.

images.alt: Photo of a city street at night.
images.description: A night time scene showing tall buildings on either side of a broad street. A bus travels by. The bus is blurry, showing that it is moving quickly.
images.caption: Tall buildings are often part of an urban landscape.

examples: Congress passed new legislation to protect the air and water.
